title: Welsh mum s burned body found at Holyhead beach after Valentines gift sent to five kids - Yahoo7
text:
‘I love you’: Mum's Valentines gift to five kids before burned body found at beach Yahoo7 News on February 15, 2017, 12:17 pm ‘I love you’: Heartbreaking mum's Valentines gift to kids less than an hour before she died Share Welsh mum s burned body found at Holyhead beach after Valentines gift sent to five kids - Yahoo7 Heartbreaking tributes have been paid to a mother of five who sent her children a loving Valentine’s Day present only days before she was reportedly found burned to death at a popular beach in north Wales. The 31-year-old woman, named by local media as Lisa Williams, sent a card in the mail to her kids, along with their five favourite chocolate treats on January 25 so the gift would arrive in time for Valentine’s Day The Mirror reports. On the card Ms Williams, from Holyhead, tells her "famous five" children how much she loves them, promising to see them soon The Mirror reports. The card that was sent to the five children for Valentine's Day. Source: Facebook "I love you all with my Welsh heart, lovely Welsh (parcel), Valentine's treats and chocolate treats," she wrote. "Will see you all soon I promise. Kind hands, kind feet, nice words and sharing is caring.” She then posted the touching note onto her Facebook page, however it’s since emerged she sent the message an hour before her body was discovered on the in the small town the BBC reports. Ms Williams' ‘badly burned’ body was reportedly found on Sunday night in a shelter at Newry Beach according to the BBC. The mother of five sent the card to her children before her death. Source: Facebook According to The Mirror the spokesman for North Wales Police said: "At approximately 10.50pm yesterday, Sunday 12 February 2017, emergency services were alerted to the discovery of a woman's body on Newry Beach, Holyhead. "She was pronounced dead at the scene and whilst no formal identification has taken place, officers believe she is a local woman and enquiries are underway to locate and inform her next of kin. "At this time the death is not being treated as suspicious, and the coroner for north-west Wales has been informed." Floral tributes have been left for the mother of five. Source: Supplied Loved ones have reportedly since left floral tributes close to the spot where her body was found, including a heartbreaking note from her father. “Our Lisa Bach [married name]. You'll always be in our hearts. Love you forever. Dad and Rachel,” the tribute began. Another said: “I'm lucky to have called you my friend. Forever in our hearts. G xx.” “Shine bright like a diamond Lisa Bach. A tribute left for the mother that was created online. Source: Facebook “Looking over your beautiful children until we meet again, love Nash xx.” Her sister Hayley Williams told Mirror online: "I couldn't be more upset. I'm heartbroken.” “We want to say thank you to family and friends for all the support." According to various local reports the mother had recently separated with her husband. It is understood an inquest is to be opened soon according to Daily Post.
